Package com.fgonzalesv

Class Ticket

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fgonzalesv.Ticket
  • public class Ticket
extends java.lang.Object
    A Ticket class to receive input from user about a driving ticket, calculate fine and output fine notice.
    Author:
    Fernando Gonzales-Vigil

              int speed,
              int speedLimit,
              boolean school,
              boolean work)
        Creates a Ticket object with the given name, speed, speed limit, school zone and work zone.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the violator
        speed - speed violator was going
        speedLimit - the speedlimit
        school - whether in a school zone or not
        work - whether in a work zone or not

      • calculateFine

        public double calculateFine()
        Calculate the speeding fine. Calculate the fine based on the following: 1 - 10 MPH over limit - $140 minimum school zone - $200 work zone - $250 11 - 30 MPH over limit - $195 minimum school zone - $310 work zone - $360 surcharge of $300 for 21 - 30 MPH over 31 MPH + over limit - must appear personally surcharge of $450 for 31 - 40 MPH over surcharge of $675 for 41 MPH and up
        Returns:
        the fine for this speed based on the speedLimit

      • TicketType

      • getDrivingZone

        private java.lang.String getDrivingZone()
        Generate a string to describe the driving zone according to ticket conditions.
        Returns:
        the driving zone string depending if work or school is true, or both are false.

      • printNotice

        public java.lang.String printNotice()
        Print a notice to be sent to the speeder Must follow exact format. See assignment description Note: There are no blank lines before "Department of Motor Vehicles" There are two blank lines between "Automated Traffic Enforcement" and the "Dear (name)" There is one black line between "Dear (name)" and "Please pay ..." Based on the following data: Name: Betty Boop Speed: 58 Speed Limit: 25 School Zone: No Work Zone: Yes Department of Motor Vehicles Automated Traffic Enforcement Dear Betty Boop, Please pay the following speeding fine of $450.00 to the DMV within 10 days of receiving this notice to avoid a driverâ€™s license suspension. You are being fined for going 58 MPH in a 25 MPH work zone. Ticket Type: MUST APPEAR You must appear at the County Court House on October 5, 2018 (day is randomly generated) Ticket Number: 936826 (number is randomly generated) Returned checks are subject to a returned check fee of $35.00. Sincerely, Fernando Gonzales-Vigil
        Returns:
        the notice to be sent to the speeder

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A toString method that returns a string representation of a Ticket, including the ticket number and ticket type. No specific format required.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
